drupalNodeEvent.title: Frontiers in Chinese Studies - Historical Minds and Artificial Intelligence: How AI Helps Rediscover Ancient Minds

field_speakers.processed: Yuqi Chen 陳鈺琪, PhD Candidate (History), Peking University

field_organizers.processed: Organized by Song Chen With Support from the China Institute at Bucknell University

field_description.processed:
In recent years, advances in artificial intelligence, particularly in natural language processing, has enabled large-scale quantitative analysis of historical texts, thus thereby making it possible to systematically investigate the minds of past generations. This talk will present two cases showcasing the application of AI models in historical research. Employing generative large language models, the first case uses AI agents to reenact intellectual debates in Chinese history. The second case uses embedding models to quantify psychological constructs in historical texts and explores the evolution of cultural psychology in premodern China over the course of two millennia.

Time: 7–8 p.m. (US Eastern Time), Wednesday, September 18, 2024
